content:
DynamicActivity Class

In this Article

Provides an object model that allows you to construct activities dynamically that interface with the WF designer and runtime using ICustomTypeDescriptor.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("Implementation")]
public sealed class DynamicActivity : System.Activities.Activity, System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Activities.Activity
  • DynamicActivity

Returns a collection of attributes of the dynamic activity.

Returns the default property for the dynamic activity.

Returns the collection of events of the dynamic activity using a specified array of attributes as a filter.

ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetPropertyOwner(PropertyDescriptor)

Returns this instance of the DynamicActivity class.

Constructors

  • DynamicActivity()

    Creates a new instance of the DynamicActivity class.

    public DynamicActivity ();

    Remarks

    With DynamicActivity you can create new activities without creating new types. DynamicActivity with its associated XAML support in ActivityXamlServices allows new arguments to be defined in XAML and bound by the host without requiring XAML to be compiled.

Properties

  • Attributes

    Gets the collection of attributes of the dynamically generated activity.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<Attribute> Attributes { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<Attribute>

      The collection of attributes.

  • Constraints

    Returns a collection of Constraint activities that are configured to provide validation for the DynamicActivity.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.Activities.Validation.Constraint> Constraints { get; }

    Property Value

    • Collection<Constraint>

      The constraint collection.

  • Implementation

    Gets or sets the execution logic of the activity.

    public Func<System.Activities.Activity> Implementation { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Func<Activity>

      The execution logic.

    Example

    The following example shows how to specify the implementation for a dynamic activity. 

                // Variables
            var iterationVariable = new DelegateInArgument<int>() { Name = "iterationVariable" };
            var accumulator = new Variable<int>() { Default = 0, Name = "accumulator" };

            // Define the Input and Output arguments that the DynamicActivity binds to
            var numbers = new InArgument<List<int>>();
            var average = new OutArgument<double>();
            
            var result = new Variable<double>() { Name = "result" };

            return new DynamicActivity()
            {
                DisplayName = "Find average",
                Properties = 
                {
                    // Input argument
                    new DynamicActivityProperty
                    {
                        Name = "Numbers",
                        Type = typeof(InArgument<List<int>>),
                        Value = numbers
                    },
                    // Output argument
                    new DynamicActivityProperty
                    {
                        Name = "Average",
                        Type = typeof(OutArgument<double>),
                        Value = average
                    }
                },
                Implementation = () =>
                    new Sequence
                    {
                        Variables = { result, accumulator },
                        Activities =
                        {
                            new ForEach<int>
                            {
                                Values =  new ArgumentValue<IEnumerable<int>> { ArgumentName = "Numbers" },                                
                                Body = new ActivityAction<int>
                                {
                                    Argument = iterationVariable,
                                    Handler = new Assign<int>
                                    {
                                        To = accumulator,
                                        Value = new InArgument<int>(env => iterationVariable.Get(env) +  accumulator.Get(env))
                                    }
                                }
                            },

                            // Calculate the average and assign to the output argument.
                            new Assign<double>
                            {
                                To = new ArgumentReference<double> { ArgumentName = "Average" },
                                Value = new InArgument<double>(env => accumulator.Get(env) / numbers.Get(env).Count<int>())
                            },
                        }
                    }
  • ImplementationVersion

    Gets or sets the implementation version of the activity.

    public Version ImplementationVersion { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Version

      The implementation version of the activity.

  • Name

    The name to be displayed for the activity in the workflow designer.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The activity name.

  • Properties

    Gets the collection of properties that map to the arguments of the dynamically generated activity.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.KeyedCollection<string,System.Activities.DynamicActivityProperty> Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • KeyedCollection<String,DynamicActivityProperty>

      The collection of properties.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetAttributes()

    Returns a collection of attributes of the dynamic activity.

    System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetAttributes ();

    Returns

    • AttributeCollection

      The attributes of the dynamic activity.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetClassName()

    Returns the class name of the dynamic activity.

    string ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetClassName ();

    Returns

    • String

      The class name.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetComponentName()

    Returns the component name of the dynamic activity.

    string ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetComponentName ();

    Returns

    • String

      The component name.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetConverter()

    Returns a type converter for the dynamic activity.

    System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetConverter ();

    Returns

    • TypeConverter

      A type converter for this dynamic activity instance.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultEvent()

    Returns the default event for the dynamic activity.

    System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultEvent ();

    Returns

    • EventDescriptor

      The default event.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultProperty()

    Returns the default property for the dynamic activity.

    System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultProperty ();

    Returns

    • PropertyDescriptor

      The default property.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEditor(Type)

    Returns an editor with the specified base type.

    object ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEditor (Type editorBaseType);

    Parameters

    • editorBaseType
      Type

      The base type of the editor you want to find.

    Returns

    • Object

      An instance of the editor that can be cast to the specified editor type or null if no editor of the requested type can be found.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents()

    Returns the collection of events of the dynamic activity.

    System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents ();

    Returns

    • EventDescriptorCollection

      The collection of events.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents(Attribute[])

    Returns the collection of events of the dynamic activity using a specified array of attributes as a filter.

    System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents (Attribute[] attributes);

    Parameters

    • attributes
      Attribute[]

      An array that you can use as a filter.

    Returns

    • EventDescriptorCollection

      The collection of events that match the specified attributes.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties()

    Returns the collection of properties of the dynamic activity.

    System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties ();

    Returns

    • PropertyDescriptorCollection

      The collection of properties.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties(Attribute[])

    Returns the collection of properties of the dynamic activity using a specified array of attributes as a filter.

    System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties (Attribute[] attributes);

    Parameters

    • attributes
      Attribute[]

      An array that you can use as a filter.

    Returns

    • PropertyDescriptorCollection

      The collection of properties that match the specified attributes.

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

  • ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetPropertyOwner(PropertyDescriptor)

    Returns this instance of the DynamicActivity class.

    object ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetPropertyOwner (System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor pd);

    Parameters

    • pd
      PropertyDescriptor

      The property whose owner is to be found.

    Returns

    • Object

      This instance of DynamicActivity.

    Remarks

    The pd parameter is ignored by this method. This parameter is present to implement the ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the DynamicActivity instance is cast to an ICustomTypeDescriptor interface.
